New Records: Ranger Suárez struck out the first five batters, the first Phillies pitcher to achieve that feat since Cole Hamels in 2010.
The Braves hit at least three home runs in a game for the 26th time this season, the most in the National League.
Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia hit two home runs in the game.
Bryson Stott and J.T. Realmuto hit solo home runs for the Phillies.
Ranger Suárez gave up back-to-back home runs in the third inning.
Reynaldo López gave up one run and tossed four-hit ball over six innings, striking out six.
Pierce Johnson, Joe Jiménez, and Dylan Lee preserved the lead for the Braves.
Pre-Game Insights: Bryce Harper mentioned he has been battling nagging wrist and elbow issues.
Harper has not homered since Aug. 9, a string of 77 consecutive plate appearances.
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on the mislocated pitches that led to home runs.
Bryce Harper acknowledged the Braves as a really good team and expressed optimism about the next two games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies paid respects to Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Gaudreau, who were killed by a suspected drunk driver.
Phillies reliever José Alvarado returned to the team after being placed on the restricted list for a personal matter.
All-Star third baseman Alec Bohm did not play due to a hurt left hand.
